author: Staff Reporter
text:
The special centre teachers attending the training programme in Tuticorin on Tuesday.— Photo: N. Rajesh

Education volunteers were trained in the proper way to handle school dropouts in classrooms at a programme organised by Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan (SSA).

For easy understanding

During the session inaugurated by M. Sakthivel, Assistant Project Director, SSA, Tuticorin, the volunteers were exposed to teaching methods and applications to help students understand Mathematics comprehensively with the aid of teaching and learning materials.

The programme was organised as per the guidance of M. Ramakrishnan, Chief Educational Officer. The dropouts should be able to learn Mathematics easily and eliminate fear for the subject, said M. Koodalingam, District Coordinator, Out of School Children, SSA.

In the current academic year, 1,073 dropouts had been identified in various blocks in the district. The dropouts were educated at SSA’s special training centres. He said that 31 long-term special training centres were functioning in the district.

Thirty six education volunteers attended the programme.
title: Training for education volunteers
